result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing Before Honorable LaMont Jacobson July 14, 2016

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph E. Glenetske
Current: PO Box 900, Redgranite Correctional Institute, Redgranite, WI 54970-0900 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2016)
Prior: 205 Lawrence Street, Schofield, WI 54476 United States
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:55 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF53, 15CF418, 15CM223, AND 15CM226. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Jay Kronenwetter.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF53: Ct. 1 (Knowingly Possess Methamphetamine Waste/PTAC/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF418: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM223: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM226: Ct. 3 (Resisting an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF53: Amended Ct. 1 (Knowingly Possess Methamphetamine Waste/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF418: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CM226: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF53: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES. 
In 15CF418: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES. 
                    : Ct. 5>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
In 15CM226: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
                     : Ct. 2>>2 years imprsonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through unless already completed; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; letter of apology to D.M. - to be furnished to agent to be forwarded to D.M.; pay restitution as set forth in restitution order - to be paid out of 25% of prison wages; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other and to any other sentence def is currently serving. 

COURT FINDS def entitled to sentence credit as follows: 
In 15CF53>>389 days credit. 
In 15CF418>>280 days credit. 
In 15CM226>>377 days credit. 

COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Adj: 2:23 pm
